arts.ttl: Serie A | Cagliari 1-2 Lazio: Match Report
arts.sum: Lazio bounced back from recent setbacks to claim a crucial 2-1 win over Cagliari at the Unipol Domus on Monday night. The victory propelled the Biancocelesti into fourth place in Serie A, showcasing their resilience after consecutive losses to Fiorentina and SC Braga. The match began with both sides creating early opportunities. Cagliari’s Nicolas Viola tested Ivan Provedel with a long-range effort, while Roberto Piccoli narrowly missed connecting with a dangerous cross. Lazio thought they had taken the lead when a series of deflections resulted in the ball finding the net, but VAR intervened to disallow the goal for handball. The post Serie A | Cagliari 1-2 Lazio: Match Report appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Taty Castellanos’ Winner Earns Lazio Timely Win in Cagliari
arts.sum: Lazio return from Sardinia with three precious points in the back after besting Cagliari by two goals to one. Lazio Starting Lineup Marco Baroni went for his strongest available lineup, as Taty Castellanos started in attack supported by Gustav Isaksen, Boulaye Dia and Mattia Zaccagni, while Nicolo Rovella and Matteo Guendouzi combined in the double […] The post Taty Castellanos’ Winner Earns Lazio Timely Win in Cagliari appeared first on The Laziali.
